nodes.bodyText: Do you really need both init() and initZk()?
actually not. We can move initZk to init
It must be the responsibility of ZkClient...
initZk creates connection to ZK. The whole idea of this patch is to split creating of ZkClient instance and connecting to ZK.
Terrible logic tangling between this class and it's parent. I can't propose anything to fix it right now... except removing this nodesValidated flag.

I want to solve following problem.
We need to check that we connected to ZK and it works fine. We need to check not one, but on every action (when we receive tupple, when we reading massage from kafka, etc)
So this check must be fast. Current check method checks

that we connected to zk
that we able to create nodes and default nodes were created

If we will check just 1 it would be useless. Because clients wouldn't able to work with Zookeeper.
Maybe I can rename isConnectionAlive method to something else. like isZooKeeperZeady ToWork
Why we have !nodesValidated here? Especially when ZcClient is not controlling this flag value?
To be ensured that nodes were validated. In ZkWatchDog and ZkClient
validateNodes() will never be called, if initZk() on previous line raise exception.
And what is the problem? nodesValidated wouldn't be set to true? If yes it exactly what I want. To return false in isCOnnectionAlive in this case
